fields.description:
On IAM user detail page, when updating a quota value, entering 0 would results in a long, complicated error notification message. However, the value on the page remains 0, so it leads to believe that the quota has been reset, but when revisited the page, it can be seen that the value was reset to the previous value before 0 was entered.

See the attachment.
fields.summary: On IAM user detail page, when a quota value is entered 0, it shows a long error notification, but the value stays 0.

comments.body: I know that 0 is a valid value. There must be some other error in the policy. Being "code" generated, that is worry-some.
[~dkavanagh], [~scottb]: We will probably need to mark this as a KI for 4.0 since EUCA-8578 remains an open issue.
I get an error like that (but with shorter policy) setting only the values shown in the screenshot. I can only assume there's a typo in one of the IAM policy limit conditions.
[~dkavanagh], zero is not currently a permitted quota value. It may be possible to fix EUCA-8578 for 4.1 if using zero is preferred to removing the quota statement.
Thanks, Steve. I coded around this, but commented on the linked ticket. If EUCA-8578 is addressed, I should remove the condition added in the PR above.
[~dkavanagh]: Is GUI-1029 still blocked by EUCA-8578?
no. It doesn't depend on it, but if that one is fixed, we have to revert this change. (as I mentioned above)

This issue doesn't appear to be fixed, as the error notice is still displayed when 0 is entered for quota values on the IAM user detail page.

Tested with the following…
Account: ui-test-acct-02/admin
User: user00
CLC host: 10.111.5.201
Console package:  4.1.0-0.0.4998.289.20141219gita4af989.el6
Browser: Firefox 34

Entering 0 in any of the quota fields no longer displays an error message on the IAM user detail page.

Tested with the following…
Account: ui-test-acct-02/admin
CLC host: 10.111.5.201
Console package:  4.1.0-0.0.5016.294.20141222git75b854b.el6
Browser: Firefox 34
